intro: Renealmia bracteata, commonly known as the pink dwarf sedge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Renealmia bracteata is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive pinkish flowers and compact growth habit.
